website_summaries.verdict: Cute, cuddly, educational, and entertaining. This Octoplush offers great versatility in the form of a huggable educational toy to help your little one learn about colors, this is a great option.
pros: Adorable design is friendly, inviting, and soft
Each leg features an image and color that's pronounced when squeezed and followed by a quick melody
Language can be set to English, Spanish, or French for multilingual learning
cons: Smaller babies may need some help when it comes to squeezing the tentacles

website_summaries.verdict: A cute and educational plush octopus that's big on features and easy on the wallet.
pros: For every hug, little ones are rewarded with a classical melody
Each tentacle can be squeezed to learn the names of different colors in three different languages
cons: Excellent for babies and toddlers, but the design may not appeal to older children

customer_reviews.title: Not what I ordered
customer_reviews.text: I received a completely different octopus than what was pictured. It came in a plain white and black box not like the colorful baby Einstein box. The octopus also looked much cheaper and the colors were different. It had a cheap looking yellow bow tie instead of the blue bow tie. The bottom of its legs were black and white not yellow and orange. Very disappointed. I will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Shopaholic

customer_reviews.title: 6 month old loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My six month old absolutely adores this toy. Honestly she almost likes it too much because when she sees it she starts shrieking and bouncing and gets really hyper. Sometimes we have to take it away so she can calm down before getting it back. She hugs it really hard and will wiggle along to the music. It is very easy for her to push the buttons and manipulate the toy. It was definitely worth the cost for how much she loves it.
customer_reviews.author: sarzsa

customer_reviews.title: An instant hit!  No issues with alignment of color / sound buttons.  Great addition to our baby sensory activities.
customer_reviews.text: This has been on my "baby wish list" for awhile now, and it made it's way into my cart the other day. It arrived yesterday afternoon, and the kids (just under 5 months) already LOVE IT! They smile at her (we call her "Olivia") and hug her to activate the sounds. It's soft and lovely and the sounds are very nice. Our colors and sounds are lined up. Some of the other reviewers mentioned that the sound that says "brown" isn't actually on the brown tentacle. This is NOT the case with ours. They are all accurate. I think this will be a favorite of ours for quite some time!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole D.Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Update!  Doesn’t work anymore
customer_reviews.text: Update: 6/21/2019 stopped working after less than 4 months. Just completely does nothing now. Pricey for a glorified stuffed animal. We have the newer cheaper version talked about in many reviews. I was pleased with it but it stopped working correctly after about 2 months and then just stopped altogether. We apparently got the “cheaper” “updated” version some reviews talk about but my almost 6 month loves this thing. We have had it for a few months and she gets so excited when she sees it. I’m not sure why but I think it’s the octopus’s grin. Plays some songs. Tells some colors. Nice and soft easy to activate sounds.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed in this. I expected to buy what I saw in the picture and instead I am getting a cheap looking, pale octopus that didn't look like the one in the picture at all. The one I received is black and white underneath. It just looks cheap to be honest. I think the seller needs to change the picture so that these disappointments don't keep happening. Will likely return.
customer_reviews.author: Dora

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: This item was great, until it wasn't. My babies are chewers. They pinched the sensor in the tentacle that says "blue". So now it randomly chants "blue, blue, blue" all hours of the day. It could be days since it's been touched and it'll randomly say "blue". We've had to permanently shut it off. Great toy, not durable enough for babies who put things in their mouths.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs T.

customer_reviews.title: FALSE ADVERTISING
customer_reviews.text: The product I received does not match the picture of the one I thought I was purchasing. The detailing on the face in the picture is different from what I received. The mouth is blue with a pink tongue, not pink wth a lighter pink tongue. No "cheek" markings, eyes are smaller. I think the whole item is smaller. The bowtie is a yellow ribbon not the blue felt & the underside is black and white. Very disappointed and sending back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I wish I had seen this when I was shopping ...
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had seen this when I was shopping for Christmas for my 6 month old. I got it for her 1st birthday and it might be a little young for her. Although, she was mimicking the "Yellow" leg the other day, so she still might get something out of it. I wish the legs spoke aloud the object on them instead of only the color. The songs played when pressing the head are a bit long.
customer_reviews.author: Meagan Claire

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product and good price!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it as a gift for a one year old baby! I love that this toy is very educational and stimulating. When you press the face of the octupus, it plays tunes from Bach, Beethoven, and Mozart. Each tentacles says different colors and it can also speak 3 languages (English, Spanish, French). The doll needs 2 AA batteries and it's very soft and cuddly.
customer_reviews.author: MarjD

customer_reviews.title: MY DAUGHTER IS OBSESSED
customer_reviews.text: This toy has kept my daughter entertained for months. I don't know what it is about it but she loves the songs. Oh man, if I make this thing DANCE- watch out! We're headed straight for smile town. I will say when it's low on batteries it starts freaking out and just playing a couple notes or skipping. I was scared it was broken but once I put new batteries in it it was fine.
customer_reviews.author: PerfectPeanutTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after a few weeks.
customer_reviews.text: My kid loved the toy, and we loved it as Parents too. We had this bought long before our baby arrived in anticipation and only opened and started using it about 2-3 weeks ago. Already the toy is broken and does not play the music anymore. The tentacles still work, but not the music. And its not like our baby destroyed it, he is 2 months old, and the toy has only been operated by adults. Disappointed, especially considering I wrote to baby Einstein about this and received no response.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Schrag

customer_reviews.title: All of the babies enjoyed it
customer_reviews.text: While purchased for my 8 month old grand-daughter, there were 2 other children of similar age present when she played with this toy. They also seemed to enjoy the sounds and texture of the toy. Additionally, my daughter in law appreciated the volume control (and off switch). She REALLY liked the ability to change languages as she has been speaking both English and Spanish to my grand-daughter. Over all, we could not have asked for a more educational "fun" toy for a child this age at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Gammy Effie

customer_reviews.title: My granddaughter changed my mind.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter in law put this toy on her baby registry and, though I didn't find it particularly appealing, I bought it for her. As it turns out, it is a big hit for my granddaughter now that she is almost four months old. She starts smiling the minute she sees the octupus' face (must be something in his eyes) and she attentively listens to every sound effect he produces. Seeing her enjoyment, I have revised my original opinion and find him adorable.
customer_reviews.author: tachi1Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Plays Sounds Not Music
customer_reviews.text: Cute toy. Doesn't play music like I expected. To change the languages you have to un-velcro the back and switch on the battery so it's not easy to transition between languages. Each leg says something but doesn't play a song so doesn't really entertain my 7 month old. The top is soft, the bottom is more of a silky material. It's cute but again not what I was expecting. I wouldn't get it again personally because it doesn't do what I was expecting and my LO isn't interested but it's not a bad toy. I think it just depend on your child.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: So much for so little. Appeals to all.
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased for my four month old grandson. As he has become aware he loves to gaze at the colors and sounds. However his four year old sister is sharing it with him. She has learned her colors in Spanish and French now. She's a very advanced four year old and can't wait to teach her brother everything. Finding a great quality toy that is educational is pretty easy. But to find this for $13 was an incredible value. My daughter had not seen one before and thought it was $29 or more. Nice quality, not too over the top, even seemed to appeal to adults hearing colors in foreign speak. Happily exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Hondaddy

customer_reviews.title: Looks faded and used
customer_reviews.text: The octopus looks like it's been used and old. Color is faded and uneven.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not washable. Think about kids germs.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 9 mo. old Grandson. He wasn't too thrilled about it for some reason. It is cute and the music is fine. But, he went home with being sick, and there is no way to wash or disinfect this toy. In conclusion. If you have a baby and need to disinfect items, make sure to get something that you can do that to. Grammy.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Educational!
customer_reviews.text: Your little one doesn't know that he or she has a mind that's made of "jello". We as parents and Grandparents should teach all aspects of learning, including music from Classic composers, diversity in language and enjoying time spent with the colors, numbers & fun, no matter how little they may be. We need to throw a lot at them while their mind is "setting" (jello) and keeping this up till probably age 4 1/2 or so. This sweet little Octopus will help you in the process.
customer_reviews.author: dawnyfox

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Friend had this toy and baby loved it so I bought one for him. Unfortunately it broke within a couple of weeks. It's stuck on the word brown and keeps saying it repeatedly. I can turn off the sound and he can still play with it, but it's not nearly as cool without the music etc.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No safety guarantee for newborn!
customer_reviews.text: I reordered this as the first was received with joy. This came without a box, authentication, and safety information, I think it is a fraud. Please do not buy it. Who would give this to a newborn, when it has no product safety information? I thought the reorder would be a great gift for another mother to be be who was at the first shower. Waste of my time and I am alarmed for infants for whom this I intended!
customer_reviews.author: Geraldine H. Leogh

customer_reviews.title: Bought a second one
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this for the second time. Originally we bought it when my son was really little. He absolutely loved it even as he got older and unfortunately it was put thru the washing machine recently. My son was very upset so we got him a new one. This one is a bit different than the one we bought a few years ago. The original one had multiple colors on the bottom and this one just has the gold color but all in all still love it
customer_reviews.author: JLLM

customer_reviews.title: Super cute!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this little guy, he’s smaller than I pictured but perfect size for little ones to hold. The buttons are very easy to press and don’t require any strength at all which is great for babies. The music he plays when you press his face is nice the tentacles just saying colors isn’t too exciting but the music makes up for that.
customer_reviews.author: MommaBradley413

customer_reviews.title: Super cute, soft & baby LOVES it!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves Neptune (this octopus) as she has another Neptune toy and he’s also on the baby Einstein jumper she has. I personally love the newer model better, compared to the older one pictured in reviews this one is less creepy and more true to how Neptune looks on everything else. I also appreciate the songs it plays are different than the other baby Einstein toys as having all their toys playing the same songs gets old (especially when you hear them all day 😂), and you can choose the language (it plays one at a time) so you don’t have to go through all 3 at once (English, Spanish, and French)
customer_reviews.author: mkm1217

customer_reviews.title: Cute but dies fast
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a Christmas gift for my daughter. It’s a cute doll that says all the colors and plays cute tones, you can also switch it to English, Spanish, or French. However within 1 or 2 weeks it already died. It stopped saying colors and it freezes when the music plays so I constantly have to switch it on and off to get it to kind of work again.
customer_reviews.author: AleeshaBoo

customer_reviews.title: good learning toy
customer_reviews.text: this was one of my sons favorite toys. It worked well and it lasted a long time. Only thing I can say that was wrong with it was that when it said the color yellow it was hilarious. I cant even explain the way it said it. At first I thought maybe it was just me then I showed my husband and he automatically started laughing. I didn't read anything about this in the reviews I read so maybe it was just a defect in the one we received. Still a good toy though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cute but chuckyish lol
customer_reviews.text: It is cute and such but every time I move the toy, if the power hasn't been turned off, it hollers "brown"--brown is the sensitive tentacle. First time it did that it scared me a little. On the 10th time it was annoying. Had to remember to turn off the power after each use--which i know I should do but can't remember every time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Daughter loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves it. I hated it at first because every time I bumped it the toy would start playing music or it would say the random color I accidentally pushed. Now it is just more background noise. The songs do get stuck in your head. it also sits awkwardly because it is too heavy since the battery is in it's head. This also drove me nuts when I first got it. It is super cute and worth buying.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be good value for the price
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this toy and the music that it plays. She’s only four months old so she hasn’t quite figured out the connection between the colors and pushing the button but she gets upset anytime the music goes off so she loves listening to the music that it plays. It’s very good it’s pretty good quality for the price and seems so far like it is lasting. If I have any problems like some other reviewers did with this new version I will update.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan Conner

customer_reviews.title: Small and cheap looking
customer_reviews.text: My oldest son had a baby Einstein musical octopus when he was a baby and so I ordered this thinking it would be similar. This one is rather small, which doesn't bother me as much as the fact that it just seems cheaply made. The material is super rough and scratchy and the stitching is uneven on mine. And it's super irritating that you cannot turn it off once the song starts! If you accidentally turn it on while cleaning up while the baby is sleeping you're SOL.
customer_reviews.author: real.mrs.irvine

customer_reviews.title: English/Spanish/French plus music
customer_reviews.text: This is a great educational toy. It has colors on the tentacles, and when they say each color. The language can be easily changed from one to the other with the button inside the head. Dislike--understandable, but not washable due to the wires to the tentacle tips
customer_reviews.author: B. Steiner

customer_reviews.title: Fun Educational Toy for Grown-ups
customer_reviews.text: This toy is a delight. I have now relearned all my major colors, and have even learned a few tunes to hum, too. Oh, and my 1-year-old granddaughter enjoys watching me play with it, too. Sometimes I even let her play with it, and she loves it! Well worth the price--a delightful little item. Thank you to whoever thought it up and produced it.
customer_reviews.author: The Green Phantasm

customer_reviews.title: Brings baby joy!
customer_reviews.text: Our baby has loved this from day one. We have it by her diaper changing station and push for the melodies and she gets this silly grin on her face. She also tries to hit the arms of the octopus with her hands. We can’t wait until she’s old enough to be more interactive with the colors. We love the fact that it teaches different languages. Very soft toy, and there are lots of things to teach your child using this toy.
customer_reviews.author: MarieCP

customer_reviews.title: my baby is obsessed with this thing.
customer_reviews.text: My little guy LOVES this octopus. He doesn't care if it is the 2nd generation and "not as good as the previous one" as some of the reviews state. He likes that he can snuggle/ chew/ play with it. I like that it makes/ keeps him happy and entertained. I have one at home and he has one at daycare. Other kids seem to like them, as well. The volume is not adjustable, but it's a reasonable volume.
customer_reviews.author: J. Meyer

customer_reviews.title: She smiles every time is makes music.
customer_reviews.text: She smiles every time is makes music. Hopefully as she gets a little bigger she'll start to repeat the words. We love that it has both English and Spanish. These are the two languages we are teaching my grandbaby. Don't think we'll use the French but it's a nice option too.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Great toy!!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this toy and so does my grandson! The musical sounds are clear and not offensive to the ears. It's a well made product that I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: DS

customer_reviews.title: ... our five month old niece because the reviews were fantastic. She didn't show much interest when we gave ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for our five month old niece because the reviews were fantastic. She didn't show much interest when we gave it to her (we were only there for a weekend visit) but since then, she has become obsessed with it. I highly recommend this if you need a nice, cute, inexpensive baby gift that will actually keep baby busy for a few minutes.
customer_reviews.author: MSD

customer_reviews.title: It breaks- fast.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this for 6 weeks and it doesn’t work anymore. My daughter just turned 6 months so it obviously wasn’t abused. It makes creaky noises or will start to play and then give up. She did however, love it while it was working. My only other complaint with the product is that you have to switch the languages on the back by the battery. I feel this could be improved by just pushing the same button again for the next language.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: So cute! My son loves this toy. The sounds keep him entertained for quite a while. It also pairs well with the "Baby Neptune" DVD from the Baby Einstein collection, as the Octopus is a character in that. The music it plays is from that as well. It's a bit lighter in color than pictured. As shown it appears to be an aqua color but in reality it's almost baby blue. Still nice looking though. Two thumbs up.
customer_reviews.author: Zen Mom

customer_reviews.title: Wow, this product is very high quality for the ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this product is very high quality for the price I paid. Hands down it has the most responsive switch inside the plush toys. My 8 months old boy loves this toy. Only has it for a few days, However, we own other Baby Einstein products and so far that toy hasn't broke yet, even though my 8 months is';t really gentle at using it. Word of advice, avoid even considering buying any of the Vtech baby toys. those things break in less than a week. you will regret spending your money on it.
customer_reviews.author: Rudy Wijaya

customer_reviews.title: AGE USAGE IS OFF!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This toy is not for a three month old infant. The music is nice but color identification for a free month old ?
customer_reviews.author: MT

customer_reviews.title: Not suitable for babies who just want music to play without interruption
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my baby boy loves music. The problem is when the music is playing it stops if he presses any of the tentacles for the colors. It frustrates him. He started playing with it at 5 months. I have to put it away since he’s too young play with it and to understand why the music stops and what not to do so it doesn’t stop.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Awesome toy. Interactive and my son
customer_reviews.text: Awesome toy. Interactive and my son, 6 months old, loves it. The music it plays is great and it's soft. High quality. The pictures on each tentacle are well stitched and cute. When you press a tentacle it says a color. For example, press the green leaf it says green. Yellow star says yellow. Love this cute toy!
customer_reviews.author: Mystic Mom

customer_reviews.title: My baby loves it!
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great toy. It sings/ speaks in English, Spanish and French. If you press on the head, it plays melodies, if you press on tentacles, it says the colors (orange, green, blue, etc). My baby is fascinated by it, it became his favorite toy.
customer_reviews.author: Natalia Dominguez

customer_reviews.title: This was perfect. It is light enough he can grab it
customer_reviews.text: Had a hard time deciding on a gift for my newest grandson. He is not quite six months old. He is at the age of grabbing things and putting them in his mouth. This was perfect. It is light enough he can grab it, and it plays music when he does. He even hugs it. Very happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: J. Hainey

customer_reviews.title: Soft. Different languages. Educational
customer_reviews.text: My niece loves it. She seems to squeeze the same two legs but still she likes it.
customer_reviews.author: Erika Tatiana

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THIS
customer_reviews.text: When I first saw this I just thought it was a regular plush toy. but when it arrived it started making noise. So to find out it speaks 3 different languages of colors and it plays soothing sound songs. I love it!! My son gets so excited when he hears the noises coming from it and it is soft enough for him to eat it. Lol I gave it to him at 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Great learning toy!
customer_reviews.text: My baby boy loves this octopus! It’s great for newborns too since the bottom of the octopus legs are black and white so they just stare at the legs with music in the background. Great toy to help learn the colors, you can also change the language to Spanish or French if you flip the switch that’s on the battery pack.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: ... my son a couple of years ago and he loved it. All of them love it
customer_reviews.text: I got one for my son a couple of years ago and he loved it. All of them love it. I even ordered one for my soon to be born nephew. The only complaint is that it is sometimes possessed, it will start to play music occasionally when no one is touching it. My kids love the bright colors and music.
customer_reviews.author: Kyodi1996

customer_reviews.title: One of my girls favorites toys, however, the ...
customer_reviews.text: One of my girls favorites toys, however, the head is a little heavy and always falls back landing on "white," so all day long I hear him saying "white" since it's head keeps hitting it. Not a huge complaint, but wish the head was more flexible!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly LaPorte

customer_reviews.title: Had higher hopes
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would be a great learning toy for my little girl but she hasn't shown a lot of interest in it even at 1 yr. It's great for saying colors... But that's about where the good review ends. It doesn't seem to keep her attention or spark her interest... I see her at it now and then but foe very short periods of time. Music is similar to other Einstein toys. Not something I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: calamity

customer_reviews.title: GREAT TOY! Not irritating, with discreet on/off just in case
customer_reviews.text: Both of our boys love this toy- one will drop everything and roll towards it when the music plays, where the other likes to press the colours. Voice isn't annoying, and the classical music is refreshing in a world of irritating midi tones and catchy jingles. A smart toy, that won't drive parents crazy- and if it does happen to do so, it has a very straightforward (and hidden from children) on/off switch. I am sure that we will get many more months/years of enjoyment out of this toy. (Twin boys, 4-6 months at time of purchase)
customer_reviews.author: Mama K

customer_reviews.title: Cute!
customer_reviews.text: Really cute toy for babies. The music is played when you press the head but the only way I found to stop it is to press one of the color buttons on the end of a tentacle. There might be another way - I haven't seen the instructions. I got this for a Christmas gift and had fun playing with it while it was still in the box! I love the expression on the octopus' face!
customer_reviews.author: Sherry H

customer_reviews.title: Nice toy
customer_reviews.text: Very good to toy, the orange leg, sounds awful in Spanish, like different person and obviously not a Spanish speaker at all, since it’s only one leg we don’t mind, it’s kind of funny, but it’s a well made made toys that plays beautiful music and it’s very eye catching too!
customer_reviews.author: WM

customer_reviews.title: My baby loves it but can not be washed
customer_reviews.text: Baby loves it. It has got different music and language options (English, Spanish and French). Volume can be turned up and down. Problem is that it isn't washable, since it is plush and baby drools over it so it needs through washing but wiring in legs of octopus aren't removable. Therefore gave it 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: mubashir ahmad

customer_reviews.title: A soothing toy
customer_reviews.text: I love the size, softness, sound and cuddle pleasure that this toy provides. I read that it's one of the best musical toys for infants thru toddler stage. My 7 month old grandson loves it, and is entertained by it when we play the music.
customer_reviews.author: ferngrower

customer_reviews.title: Friendly and useful.
customer_reviews.text: Good comfort toy with some educational value. Easy for baby to hold and manipulate. I did not like the fact that you haveto open the back to change the language and turn the sound on or off. This is tedious. You should turn off the sound if the baby has it in the crib and is asleep, because the slightest touch of the tentacles activates the voice.
customer_reviews.author: Vancia

customer_reviews.title: Buy something else instead
customer_reviews.text: My one year old wants nothing to do with it. The voice is very.. annoying with no enthusiasm or character to it/very bland. It also stopped working correctly less than 3months of owning with barely any use (makes a grinding sound). There are better alternatives than this toy
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Stops working quickly.
customer_reviews.text: Super cute. Buttons easy to push. However the green button stopped working after 6 months of very minimal use. Also, mine only says one language while I see others say it says more.
customer_reviews.author: just jenn

customer_reviews.title: Neat toy
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea of this octopus. I'm pushing the whole multiple languages thing on my baby so this is pretty neat. And it doesn't go on forever with some wicked loud and annoying sounds. Just quick colors and a song that doesn't last too long. Which prevents the toy from getting on my nerves and going out the window.
customer_reviews.author: Lance

customer_reviews.title: My Niece LOVES this thing.
customer_reviews.text: Delivered on time and as advertised. My niece has had this for a year and 2 months. Carries it everywhere. Still in decent shape, lots and lots of tough love given to this thing...
customer_reviews.author: Crissie Wisdom

customer_reviews.title: Cute Toy
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my little girl. It's cute and soft, and she likes the music. She probably isn't quite old enough to appreciate all of the features yet, but she does enjoy it. The only thing I'm not wild about is the on/off/volume switch. It's not very easy to access, and it's really hard not to inadvertently start the music while trying to turn it off - not great if your little one is asleep.
customer_reviews.author: J-Bug

customer_reviews.title: Just got this, but the colors are not as ...
customer_reviews.text: Just got this, but the colors are not as vibrant as the first one we had for our first child. The blue is powder blue and the satin color patches don't exist, being replaced by a single golden color. This will not help in distinguishing with colors. Will have to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tri-lingual ocean fun
customer_reviews.text: Love the multiple languages. What kind of octopus doesn't know their colors in English, French and Spanish? This is easy for my daughter to grasp.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Octoplush for the win!
customer_reviews.text: We have now ordered 2 of these. One for our son, and one for my best friend's daughter. It plays cute music by composers, soft and cuddly, and teaches colors at the same time. Our little man fell in love with this octopus, and it eased a lot of fussy moments. He will still on occasion pick up his octopus for ol' times sake.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Such a cute musical toy for my daughter
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my daughter for a Christmas present and she loves it! The button to play music is quite sensitive so it doesn't require a lot of pressure when pressing the button. It's a nice touch to add the names of the colors when pressing on the tentacles. It has been great so far and my son enjoys it too!
customer_reviews.author: JCheng

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Bought it before baby was born. It’s been sitting there. The few months after baby played with it, it stopped playing all the colors, only songs, even on the tentacles!
customer_reviews.author: LolVS

customer_reviews.title: Love the music
customer_reviews.text: It's a little too advanced for my 6 month old but would be great for about 10+ months. My problem with it is that I purchased it for the music but all of the legs tell you which color the design on it is. It interrupts the music and stops playing to tell you the color. I wish I could temporarily turn this function off.
customer_reviews.author: Momma Bee

customer_reviews.title: Nice, well made
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my grandson who is this about seven month old. It seems like it is really nice and well babe. I am assuming it will entertain my grandbaby but I haven’t given it to him yet. It’s for Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: R.L.

customer_reviews.title: My daughter loved it at 6 months and still loves it at ...
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased my second Baby Einstein Octoplush in less than a year. My daughter loved it at 6 months and still loves it at 18 months. She repeats the colors as they are said out loud. I bought a second one because only the colors red and white still work (the color is said out loud when you push on the that color arm). I couldn't find a way to change a battery per arm so I ended up buying a whole new one.
customer_reviews.author: KReece

customer_reviews.title: Best toy for the first 3-6months
customer_reviews.text: This was the first toy my baby responded to as a newborn. It entertained her for many months and distracted her long enough to let me change her diapers. Love this toy!
customer_reviews.author: Dorsey Ladson

customer_reviews.title: Great music.
customer_reviews.text: Loved the toy. The reason I gave it a three is because the Spanish translation for the color orange was so terrible. ( Is the translator for the other colors ok? Lol. Why they didn't use the same translator for all of the colors is beyond me. )
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Not good material
customer_reviews.text: I thought that is soft material but it irritates my baby face and I am Using Aquapour to neutralize his rednesh. Cheap material. I don't recommend. The music is ok
customer_reviews.author: SedA

customer_reviews.title: Brown and yellow stopped working after playing with it for 1 month.
customer_reviews.text: This is my daughter’s favorite toy right now but the yellow and brown doesn’t work and she’s only been playing with it for a month. I bought it in August but she was too you to play with it. It’s April 7th and she is 10 months old and it already doesn’t work. It’s very cute though and she loves playing the music.
customer_reviews.author: JennRem

customer_reviews.title: A favorite
customer_reviews.text: My 9 month olds favorite toy. Does 8 different colors and music. With a flip of a switch inside the toy you can change the language the colors are given in.
customer_reviews.author: 3LittleMonkeys

customer_reviews.title: Our newest family addition!
customer_reviews.text: My baby loves this little guy so much! We affectionately call him "octy" and he is now part of our family. He pulls my little boy out of his bad mood, even when he's crying! He's a good size For my infant(3mo). A little too big for him to hold on his own this early, but he likes to lay near him or have Octy on him. Super soft and I actually am not sick of hearing the songs a million times!
customer_reviews.author: ashley

customer_reviews.title: Cute, baby likes it.
customer_reviews.text: This toy is pretty cute. My 4 (now 5) month old baby seems to really like this.
customer_reviews.author: Dawnwake

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after short period of time
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great toy. My kid loves it; however, it stopped working in less than 5 months. The batteries weren’t dead, but the colors stopped saying what they were one by one. Then some of the colors started playing music.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Piper

customer_reviews.title: soft and a great learning tool
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this item for our grandson. It's a cute item, soft and cuddly and great learning colors in 3 different languages, English, Spanish and French! Love it. Very adorable too!
customer_reviews.author: A.O NYC/TX

customer_reviews.title: Little guy loves it
customer_reviews.text: My little one loves this toy. I only wish it said the shape on each tentacle not just the color. It is overal pretty soft but where the battery pack is in his head is hard.
customer_reviews.author: marshall r owens

customer_reviews.title: I have purchased many of these!
customer_reviews.text: This little guy is a perfect gift that should last a long time. Plays classical music and says the color you squeeze. Loved by everyone I've given it to! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: LaneyBee

customer_reviews.title: Handy Baby Toy
customer_reviews.text: After you cut the many wires and plastic nubs holding this pal inside the package, your baby will love it. Has a few old timey songs and a variety of colors/foods on the legs. Has a pocket on the back to change batteries, sound, on/off, and languages. Has English, French, and Spanish. We use English.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as Christmas gift. I gave it to the family this past weekend and the dad immediately pointed out that the purple and the brown colors were switched. when you press the purple tentacle it say Brown (and vise versa) I exchanged it - check to make sure the colors are labeled correctly- otherwise great product.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri

customer_reviews.title: So so
customer_reviews.text: I guess I expected more to this toy. It’s plays a few short tunes and only says the color on the tentacles once. It is really cute though.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany Kimmell

customer_reviews.title: Super cute
customer_reviews.text: My baby girl likes this, and I think it's fun that you can change the language for the colors to either English, Spanish or French. I think it if lit up it would be more appealing to her, as I notice gears toward her toys that light up or have something she can teeth on. But overall it's so cute and soft and I just think the octopus is just so fun.
customer_reviews.author: Natasha

customer_reviews.title: INACCURACY IN photo
customer_reviews.text: Photo very inaccurate. Cute little blue bow is nowhere to be found. Sent it back and reordered but reorder same as the first one. I kept it anyway. Very disappointing I do not recommend unless willing to get similar but not the same as the photo.
customer_reviews.author: PS

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my niece for Christmas... She is 1. I have heard great things of Baby Einstein, even got it on sale. When it arrived, I was a little disappointed (that is the reason for the 4 stars), it has a lot going on for a "little" toy. I tried each one, all different languages and was very impressed. I did not have any trouble understanding this toy. Product Dimensions: 7 x 11 x 11 inches I don't agree with the product dimensions, mine was more like 5x9x9, I guess they stretched the legs as far as possible to get these dimensions. Besides the size, this is a fantastic toy and I recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Denise J. Knox

customer_reviews.title: Daughter loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves the melodies this plays. I love the multiple languages that you're able to switch to. It's not the easiest to clean, but other than that, it's a great toy.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Nicole Haigler

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after ten minutes!!
customer_reviews.text: This came and did not appear to be damaged in anyway worked only for ten minutes and now does not say the names of the colors on any language setting and only makes one sound repeatedly-clearly broken, what a crap toy!! So incredibly disappointing. Now my daughter just has a very heavy octopus to look at. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Kara M

customer_reviews.title: Great for my mother with Alzheimer's!
customer_reviews.text: Great toy for mom with Alzheimer's. I hear the music all day and night. She likes being able to get sound from it easily. Much easier than her trying to figure out the tv remote...
customer_reviews.author: Nandiqueen

customer_reviews.title: Great fun!
customer_reviews.text: Great fun. Lots of options with colors and songs AND it comes in English, French and Spanish! A great gift fir my great nephew.
customer_reviews.author: Jim D. Brown

customer_reviews.title: The idea of it is better than the execution. But my kid loved it for as long as we had it.
customer_reviews.text: We gather here to mourn the loss of dearly departed "pulpito" - who despite being a great idea and having awesome features, can't be laundered properly and eventually just says "azul" 200 times until you throw it out.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Marek

customer_reviews.title: Teaches 3 languages
customer_reviews.text: One of my favorite toys to grab for baby showers or friends who are having a baby and you don’t know the sex. Teaches the colors in 3 languages and it’s so cute!
customer_reviews.author: Jlshapiro89

customer_reviews.title: Used to like it..
customer_reviews.text: My son used to like this toy but it stilopped working after a month and the one he had had colorful tentacles at the bottom corresponding to each respective color on the tentacle. Now it seems they have changes that to an all yellow background with orange lettering which is not as cute but they seem to have improved the quality of the sailor hat. I didn't end up keeping the second one and my son does not miss the octopus.
customer_reviews.author: BNLZ

customer_reviews.title: low quality
customer_reviews.text: My baby loves this toy but unfortunately the electrical component is suboptimal. We have bought two of these and after about 2 months the toy quits playing music. The speaker quality isn't great either. I don't think I'll waste my money on anymore Baby Einstein toys.
customer_reviews.author: Cdoolady

customer_reviews.title: 1 year old loves!
customer_reviews.text: Gave this to my niece for her first birthday and she loved it. The bright colors and feel of this toy captivated her attention over and above the other toys she received. My impression was she wanted to give it five stars!
customer_reviews.author: LadyGar

customer_reviews.title: Baby's favorite toy...or Security Toy....Loves it.  But problem...sad
customer_reviews.text: Einsteind got wet from baby Saliva....Now it no longer plays any music, Very Sad. Reason for three stars, Son still loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert T.

customer_reviews.title: My niece loves it.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 8 month old niece since it doesn't seems to have any removable small pieces or anything that could come loose, she loves it and she is able to press the tentacles herself to play sounds.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Cortes

customer_reviews.title: Freaks me out
customer_reviews.text: I'm not going to lie, this toy Freaks me out. Kinda like how Chucky freaks you out when he's in his Good Guy doll form, lol. But my son likes it. He pushes the tentacles to hear the different colors and hasn't had any issue doing it.
customer_reviews.author: LaQuinta Henderson

customer_reviews.title: 3 month old amused by our Octos
customer_reviews.text: Our 3 month old doesn't care for crazily colored, ruffly or crinkly toys yet. Enter this octoplush, which baby is drawn to for its huge smile and solid blue. After guiding her to thwack his face for music a few times, she takes a few swings at him on her own. The English color sounds come out clearly but when I tested out the Spanish and French it is a little bit muffled. That would be my only complaint for this product!
customer_reviews.author: The C Family

customer_reviews.title: Cute and durable
customer_reviews.text: This little octopus elicits a smile from my 3 month old grand-daughter every time. There are plenty of things for her to attempt to grab and she likes to listen to the music. It is quite easy to clean and provides her with a fun distraction. What more can I ask?
customer_reviews.author: Angie Baker

product_meta.title: Baby Einstein Octoplush Musical Plush Toy, Ages 3 months +
product_meta.description:
Octoplush the friendly baby octopus will take your little one on an exploration of color, music and fun. The plush activity toy is lovable and huggable, and every squeeze will introduce your baby to new colors and sounds. Underneath each soft little leg, your baby will discover a colorful embroidered image. With a gentle squeeze you’ll hear the corresponding color and a short classical melody. Easily swap between English, Spanish and French so your little linguist can hear the colors in multiple languages. Plush stuffed animals like Octoplush are quick to enter a baby’s heart, and the friendship will only grow – a 2-year-old will love him as much as an infant!

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The Baby Einstein Octoplush is a soft, multi-textured, developmental plush toy. Young babies can hug Octoplush to hear a Baby Einstein melody and explore the textures for tactile development. As baby grows, colorful stitched satin patches on velour legs invite baby to learn color names through repetition. Squeeze each leg to hear color names in English, Spanish and French. Patterns of the color names are also printed on the underside of each leg in multiple languages.
feature_bullets: Baby can cuddle up to new colors and music
Huggable & soft to touch for tactile development
Discover the colors in English, Spanish and French
Squeeze Octoplush’s head to activate more classical melodies

specifications.Care instructions: Wipe clean with damp cloth and mild soap. Do not immerse in water.
specifications.Additional product features: Volume Control, Multiple Modes, Multiple Languages
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars2,942 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
